intro: Agalmyla keysseri, commonly known as the Kesseri agalmyla, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of La Réunion in the Indian Ocean. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has slender, branched stems and elliptical leaves with a glossy green surface. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
